meanings.definition: To make (something) known to the public.
meanings.sent1: The school publicised the upcoming event through flyers and announcements.
meanings.sent2: The company publicised their new product on social media.
meanings.sent3: The cat publicised its hunger by meowing loudly at the empty food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The artist publicised her unique style through a series of eye-catching paintings.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm publicised its arrival with booming thunder and bright lightning.

meanings.definition: To promote or advertise (something) to the general public.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant publicised their special offer with a banner outside.
meanings.sent2: The movie studio publicised the upcoming film with trailers and posters.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel publicised its acorn collection by proudly displaying them in a neat row.
meanings.sent4: The politician publicised his campaign promises through speeches and interviews.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks publicised the celebration with a dazzling display of colors in the night sky.
